cards.gametext: Plays on table. If you just lost a Podrace, your Force loss is limited to half the difference between the winning race total and your highest race total (round up). While you occupy three battlegrounds, Watto's Box is suspended.
cards.lore: "Poodoo!"
cards.name: A Close Race

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. At [Episode 1] Tatooine battleground sites, your Force drains are +1 and opponent's cards with ability are deploy -1. While Padme at a Tatooine battleground site, opponent's Force drains at related sites are -1. Place Effect in Used Pile if canceled.
cards.lore: In unfamiliar and potentially hostile territory, Qui-Gon knew that success would require patience and caution.
cards.name: A Remote Planet

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Once per game, may use 1 Force to stack one Interrupt just played here. To play any new Interrupt of the same name, player must first stack it here and use +1 Force for each Interrupt in stack, even if Interrupt is normally free.
cards.lore: Senator Palpatine was quick to point out the aggressions of the Trade Federation in front of the Galactic Senate.
cards.name: A Tragedy Has Occurred

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Whenever opponent retrieves X cards, opponent must first use X Force or that retrieval is canceled. (X is equal to the full amount of Force allowed to be retrieved, regardless of the number of cards in opponent's Lost Pile.)
cards.lore: The destruction of a command vehicle negatively impacts Imperial battle efficiency.
cards.name: Aim High

cards.gametext: Before any starting cards are revealed, deploy on table with up to 10 cards from outside your deck face-down under here. Cards under here do not count toward your deck limit. Three times per game, may play a Defensive Shield from here, as if from hand.
cards.lore: The peacekeepers of the galaxy are not to be taken lightly.
cards.name: An Unusual Amount Of Fear

cards.gametext: Plays on table. While opponent has a non-unique alien or non-unique starfighter in battle, opponent may not draw more than two battle destiny.
cards.lore: Young Obi-Wan has much to learn about the living Force. Patience with others is also high on that list.
cards.name: Another Pathetic Lifeform

cards.gametext: Use 4 Force (or 1 Force if Obi-Wan is armed with a lightsaber) to deploy on table if Maul present with Obi-Wan. (Obi-Wan may not move that turn.) Maul's lightsaber may add only 1 to Force drains, and may be 'swung' only once per battle. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Divide and conquer.
cards.name: Armament Dismantled

cards.gametext: Plays on table. For either player to initiate a Force drain, that player must first use 3 Force unless that player occupies a battleground site and a battleground system.
cards.lore: Even though the landing of the stolen shuttle was successful, the Rebel strike team on Endor was forced to rethink their plans when Leia disappeared.
cards.name: Battle Plan

cards.gametext: X = number of Imperials present. While with Han or Leia, adds 2 to your battle destiny draws here. During your turn, target one Imperial of power < 5 present. Target's game text canceled for remainder of turn. End of your turn: * Use 2 or (!) Lose 1 or (X).
cards.lore: \b Smuggler\b0. Very few people need to be told that angry Wookiees should be given a wide berth.
cards.name: Chewie, Enraged

cards.gametext: If opponent's Dark Jedi with at least one combat card just initiated lightsaber combat against your Jedi with none, draw 3 destiny and choose 2 to use for lightsaber combat destiny. You may take other card into hand, or return it to top of Reserve Deck.
cards.lore: There are some times, more than others, when you should not look down.
cards.name: Clinging To The Edge

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Cancels Opee Sea Killer. While no card here, you may place a card from hand face-up here. If you just drew weapon or battle destiny (limit once per destiny draw), you may exchange it for card here, which then counts as that destiny draw. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: The colo claw fish's front end is dominated by a large snout covered with two large eyes that can see deep into the murky depths. Able to survive due to its exceptional vision.
cards.name: Colo Claw Fish

cards.gametext: If your [Episode 1] Jedi just defeated Maul in lightsaber combat, draw destiny. Add 2 if Qui-Gon out of play. If total > 6, place Maul out of play and you may search your Lost Pile and take any one card into hand. (Immune to Sense.)
cards.lore: Despite coming face to face with the first Sith to be seen in a millennia, the young Padawan was still a force to be reckoned with.
cards.name: Darth Maul's Demise

cards.gametext: During a battle where your opponent has more characters participating than you, fire (for free) one blaster that cannot fire repeatedly, even if that blaster was already fired this battle. Add 1 to your total weapon destiny.
cards.lore: Han's best tactic when outnumbered? Shoot first and don't worry about asking questions later.
cards.name: Desperate Times

cards.gametext: If your starfighter with a pilot character aboard is in a battle, target an opponent's starfighter present that has no characters aboard. For remainder of battle, both starfighters are power = 0, and target starfighter is forfeit = 0. (Immune to Sense.)
cards.lore: Rebel pilots understand that what they lack in numbers, they must make up for in strategy. They often use diversions to remove dangerous opponents from a conflict.
cards.name: Diversionary Tactics

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Sense and Alter are now Lost Interrupts. When any player makes a destiny draw for Sense or Alter, and that destiny draw is successful, that player loses 2 Force.
cards.lore: A Jedi may choose to intervene in the natural course of events, but must accept responsibility for the consequences.
cards.name: Do, Or Do Not

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Once per game may take any Immediate Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While opponent occupies no battleground systems, Mobilization Points is suspended.
cards.lore: The Jedi won't tolerate silly behavior for very long.
cards.name: Don't Do That Again

cards.gametext: Deploy on North Ridge if Main Power Generators on table. When opponent deploys a character or vehicle to a marker site, activate 1 Force and that card may not move that turn. Effect lost if opponent occupies an Echo site, or your Ice Storm on table. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: "The sensors are in place. You'll know if anything comes around."
cards.name: Echo Base Sensors

cards.gametext: During your control phase, deploy on Theed Palace Generator Core. No more than one character may deploy to here each turn, and characters may not move to or from here. Immediate Effect lost at end of opponent's turn.
cards.lore: Theed security protocol proved to be a deciding variable in the duel of the fates.
cards.name: Energy Walls

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. At Endor sites where you have an Ewok, your characters are forfeit and defense value +1 (+3 if you have two Ewoks at that site.) In battles at Endor sites where all your ability is provided by Ewoks, add one battle destiny. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: "Na na, beecha na noooooooooooooooowa."
cards.name: Ewok Celebration

cards.gametext: If your Jedi was just defeated in lightsaber combat, you may either: Reveal a Dark Jedi's combat cards and place one in opponent's Lost Pile (return others). OR Place Qui-Gon out of play and take [Episode 1] Obi-Wan into hand from Lost Pile or Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
cards.lore: The blow, when it came, was lightning swift and fatal. But Qui-Gon's death gave new life to his former Padawan.
cards.name: Fall Of A Jedi

cards.gametext: Permanent pilots are (*]Han and (*]Chewie: provide ability of 5, add one battle destiny, and add 5 to power. Immune to attrition < 6, Come With Me, and Lateral Damage. End of your turn: * Use 3 or (X).
cards.lore: Although temperamental, this trusty hunk of junk always seems to perform for its proud owner and his Wookiee co-pilot when needed the most.
cards.name: Han, Chewie, And The Falcon

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Cancels Responsibility Of Command and You Overestimate Their Chances. While Brangus Glee on table, once per turn you may search opponent's Lost Pile and place all docking bays found there out of play.
cards.lore: "You can go about your business."
cards.name: He Can Go About His Business

cards.gametext: Deploys -1 on Naboo. While at Theed Palace Throne Room, once during your control phase may reveal one card (random selection) from opponent's hand. Opponent must place card in Used Pile or lose 1 Force.
cards.lore: Part of Amidala's advisory council, Horace monitors political crises, as well as providing the Queen with information regarding the current economic state of the city.
cards.name: Horace Vancil

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. You may not play Sorry About The Mess or Clash Of Sabers. During any deploy phase, you may place one card face-down under one of your Jedi. (These are that character's combat cards.) No character may have more than two combat cards at once. Instead of drawing lightsaber combat destiny or duel destiny, your participating character may use one of his combat cards. Place character's combat cards in owner's Used Pile when used (or if that character leaves the table).
cards.name: Inner Strength

cards.gametext: Deploys on Jar Jar. May 'throw' (place in Used Pile) to target a character, creature or vehicle. Draw destiny. If destiny +2 > defense value, target is landspeed = 0 and power -2 for remainder of turn.
cards.lore: Jar Jar had to be instructed on how to use an electropole prior to the battle on the Great Grass Plains. It's not his weapon of choice.
cards.name: Jar Jar's Electropole

cards.gametext: During your deploy phase, lose 1 Force to relocate [Episode 1] Obi-Wan to an adjacent Naboo site. OR Raise your converted interior Theed Palace site to the top.
cards.lore: Obi-Wan's youth combined with his Jedi training meant that he was not to be dispatched easily.
cards.name: Jedi Leap

cards.gametext: Adds one battle destiny. If opponent initiates battle at same location, retrieve 1 Force and add its destiny number to Lando's power, or power of \ul Falcon\ul0  he is piloting for remainder of battle. End of turn: * Use 1 or (!) Lose 2 or (X).
cards.lore: With a silvery tongue or a rapid-fire blaster, Lando prides himself on being able to get out of tight situations. Is at his best when cornered.
cards.name: Lando Calrissian, Scoundrel

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per turn, may target a character present with [Cloud City] Lando. For remainder of turn, target is forfeit = 0. During battle on Cloud City, you may use X Force (maximum 3) to add X to your total battle destiny. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Lando Calrissian has quite a reputation amongst gamblers and smugglers. This is not always a good thing.
cards.name: Lando's Not A System, He's A Man

cards.gametext: Twice per game, may place top card of Lost Pile on top of Reserve Deck to cancel a Force drain at a related site. Unless opponent's non-alien character here, opponent's total ability at same site = 0. Immune to attrition < 5 if with Luke, Han or Jabba.
cards.lore: After attracting Luke's attention and then Han's attention, Leia should not have been surprised when she got more attention than desired from Jabba.
cards.name: Leia, Rebel Princess

cards.gametext: Plays on table. While you occupy a Renegade planet location, operatives are forfeit = 0, operatives do not add to Force drains and your Force drains may not be reduced. \ul(Renegade planet is defined on the Objective card Imperial Occupation.)\ul0
cards.lore: The heroes of the Rebellion know that where there is life, there is hope.
cards.name: Let's Keep A Little Optimism Here

cards.dark_side_text: Your Dark Jedi are power +1 here. Force drain -1 here.
cards.gametext: Your Jedi are power +2 here.   Your Dark Jedi are power +1 here. Force drain -1 here.
cards.name: Naboo: Theed Palace Generator

cards.dark_side_text: Any characters of ability < 5 about to be 'hit' here (and all cards on them) are placed in owner's Used Pile.
cards.gametext: Any characters of ability < 5 about to be 'hit' here (and all cards on them) are placed in owner's Used Pile.  Any characters of ability < 5 about to be 'hit' here (and all cards on them) are placed in owner's Used Pile.
cards.light_side_text: Any characters of ability < 5 about to be 'hit' here (and all cards on them) are placed in owner's Used Pile.
cards.name: Naboo: Theed Palace Generator Core

cards.gametext: Deploys -2 to Naboo. Power +2 if Maul present. If Qui-Gon is participating in lightsaber combat and Obi-Wan is present, Qui-Gon may use Obi-Wan's combat cards. Immune to Sniper and attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Padawan learner promoted to Jedi Knight after his encounter with Darth Maul. Has sworn to train Anakin Skywalker, even if the Jedi Council forbids it.
cards.name: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight

cards.gametext: Deploy on [Episode 1] Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain if present at a Naboo battleground. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Add 1 if targeting a Dark Jedi. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
cards.lore: Constructed by Obi-Wan himself, this Padawan's lightsaber was responsible for tearing an ancient Sith weapon in half.
cards.name: Obi-Wan's Lightsaber

cards.gametext: Plays on table. For opponent to steal a weapon from target character using a non-[Episode 1] card, must first draw destiny. If destiny +1 > target's ability, weapon stolen. Otherwise, attempt fails and stealing card is placed out of play.
cards.lore: An elegant weapon for a more civilized age.
cards.name: Only Jedi Carry That Weapon

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Cancels Sando Aqua Monster. While no card here, may place an opponent's just-drawn battle destiny face-up here. If opponent just drew battle destiny with the same card title as card here, place both cards in opponent's Lost Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: The opee sea killer catches its prey with a long, flexible tongue. It uses camouflage to assist in hunting prey, as well as avoiding larger predators like the sando aqua monster.
cards.name: Opee Sea Killer

cards.gametext: Plays on table. At each opponent's <> site, your Rebels are each deploy -2 and your Force generation is +1.
cards.lore: Jabba's decadent behavior makes him susceptible to deception. Leia and Lando exploited this weakness, posing as Jabba's kind of scum.
cards.name: Ounee Ta

cards.gametext: Plays on any interior site. This location may not be targeted by Proton Bombs.
cards.lore: Key installations are protected from bombardment by a complex network of early warning sensors, emergency shields and fast response fighters.
cards.name: Planetary Defenses

cards.gametext: Deploys -2 to Naboo. Qui-Gon's game text may not be canceled. When Qui-Gon wins a lightsaber combat, adds 2 to opponent's Force loss. Once per game, may lose 2 Force to deploy a lightsaber on Qui-Gon from Lost Pile. Immune to attrition.
cards.lore: Jedi Master ordered by the Jedi Council to return to Naboo to seek out the mysterious "dark warrior" that he had encountered on Tatooine.
cards.name: Qui-Gon Jinn, Jedi Master

cards.gametext: Deploy on Qui-Gon or [Episode 1] Obi-Wan. Adds 1 to this character's lightsaber combat total. May target a character for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value (if hit target is a Dark Jedi, opponent also loses 1 Force).
cards.lore: This lightsaber bore silent witness to the death of two great warriors in the same day. One a Jedi, one a Sith.
cards.name: Qui-Gon's Lightsaber

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Cancels Colo Claw Fish. While no card here, you may draw destiny and place it face-up here. If you are about to draw a card for weapon or battle destiny, you may instead use card here, then place it in Lost Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: The sando aqua monster is quite a mystery to Naboo oceanographers. A reclusive predator by nature, this undersea giant appears to have no natural enemies.
cards.name: Sando Aqua Monster

cards.gametext: \b Agenda\b0 : order. While at same site as Amidala, your Force generation is +2 here. While on Naboo, subtracts one from opponent's Force drains at adjacent sites, and your other Republic characters present are power +1.
cards.lore: Governor of Naboo. After initially opposing Amidala in her campaign to become Naboo's elected ruler, Sio Bibble is now one of her most ardent supporters.
cards.name: Sio Bibble

cards.gametext: Take top card of Force Pile into hand. OR If opponent just revealed a combat card, it is canceled (place in opponent's Used Pile) and opponent must draw destiny instead (that destiny is reduced by 1). OR Cancel Maul Strikes, Dark Strike, or You Are Beaten.
cards.lore: At times it was calculated defense, at others it was simply survival.
cards.name: Strike Blocked

cards.gametext: Plays on table. While you occupy at least 3 battlegrounds or opponent occupies no battlegrounds, you lose no more than 2 Force from each Force drain or 'insert' card.
cards.lore: "Jabba! This is your last chance. Free us or die."
cards.name: Ultimatum

cards.gametext: [Front Side]: \ul Deploy Theed Palace Generator Core, Theed Palace Generator, and Inner Strength.\ul0 \par \b While\b0  this side up, opponent may not Force drain where opponent has a Dark Jedi, and your Force drains at Naboo sites where you have a Jedi may not be canceled. Once during your control phase, may target one opponent's character present with your Jedi at an interior Theed Palace site. Target is lost. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if an opponent's Dark Jedi is present at an interior Naboo battleground site.\\par[Back Side]: \b While\b0  this side up, you may not Force drain or initiate battle at any location where you have a Jedi. Once during your move phase, your Jedi may initiate lightsaber combat against an opponent's Dark Jedi present: Each player draws 2 destiny. Loser (lowest total) loses 2 Force (cannot be reduced). If difference is 5 or greater, lost Force must come from Reserve Deck, and losing character is lost. \par \b Flip\b0  this card and retrieve 1 Force if opponent has no Dark Jedi present at any interior Naboo battleground.
cards.name: We'll Handle This/Duel Of The Fates

cards.gametext: If your non-(permanent weapon) lightsaber was just lost (or stolen) from a site, deploy on your character of ability > 4 at same site. Relocate that lightsaber to this character, who may use that lightsaber, and it may not be stolen. (Immune to Control.)
cards.lore: Darth Maul's complacency in what seemed like imminent victory over the Padawan was his downfall. That, and the lightsaber of Obi-Wan's fallen teacher.
cards.name: Weapon Of A Fallen Mentor

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Your Immediate Effects may plays for free. Whenever opponent cancels your card with Sense or Alter, place that canceled card in Used Pile.
cards.lore: The guidance of experienced Jedi allowed Luke to confront Vader.
cards.name: Wise Advice

cards.gametext: Deploys only to Naboo or Coruscant. Once per game, may take a Sense, Control, or Alter into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your Jedi present are immune to attrition < 4 (or < 5 if a Jedi Council member). Immune to attrition.
cards.lore: \b Jedi Council member\b0. "More to say have you?"
cards.name: Yoda, Master Of The Force

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Cancels Scanning Crew. If an 'insert' card was just inserted or revealed, it is canceled.
cards.lore: Luke knew that while the dark side was quicker and more seductive, eventually evil would turn on itself.
cards.name: Your Insight Serves You Well

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Cancels A Dangerous Time. Each player may play only one card with "sabacc" in title each turn. You may cancel an opponent's card with "sabacc" in title by losing 1 Force from hand.
cards.lore: Han was not sure if Lando had forgiven him for winning the \ul Millennium Falcon\ul0. As the old gamblers' saying about sabacc goes: "Win the game, lose a friend."
cards.name: Your Ship?

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Cancels Don't Underestimate Our Chances. When opponent plays an Interrupt and has 3 smugglers on table, if that Interrupt is placed in Lost Pile, place it out of play. Ketwol may exchange a docking bay only once per game.
cards.lore: Imperial officers aboard the Death Star considered the Rebellion a minor threat.
cards.name: A Useless Gesture

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Once per game, may use 1 Force to stack one Interrupt just played here. To play any new Interrupt of the same name, player must first stack it here and use +1 Force for each Interrupt in stack, even if Interrupt is normally free.
cards.lore: With the Republic groaning under the weight of its own bureaucracy, senators accuse, bicker, and fight to further their own agendas.
cards.name: Allegations Of Corruption

cards.gametext: Deploy on Aurra Sing. May target a character or creature for free. Target loses any immunity to attrition for remainder of turn. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value. Jedi hit by Aurra Sing are power = 0 for remainder of battle.
cards.lore: Aurra Sing's weapon of choice when she isn't using an opponent's lightsaber against them. Targeting mechanism is so complex only Aurra Sing herself can decipher it.
cards.name: Aurra Sing's Blaster Rifle

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Unless Battle Plan on table, for either player to initiate a Force drain, that player must first use 3 Force unless that player occupies a battleground site and a battleground system.
cards.lore: Administration of the Imperial installation on Endor includes coordination of troops on the ground and tight security provided by the Empire's space fleet.
cards.name: Battle Order

cards.gametext: While with Jabba, power +3 and, during your draw phase, may use 1 Force to count the number of cards in your Force Pile, place your Force Pile in your Used pile, and then activate Force up to the counted number.
cards.lore: Twi'lek who serves as Jabba's major-domo. First to discover the profitability of ryll spice found on Ryloth.
cards.name: Bib Fortuna

cards.gametext: May add 6 passengers. Permanent pilots provide ability of 4. When deployed, you may deploy (for free) an Imperial warrior aboard from your Reserve Deck; reshuffle. End of your turn: * Use 1 or (X).
cards.lore: Staffed by an experienced crew. Blizzard 4's role in all engagements is to seek out new terrain uncovered by the initial offensive thrust and unload troops to hold it. \b Enclosed\b0.
cards.name: Blizzard 4

cards.dark_side_text: If you occupy, Force generation +1 for your here, and opponent's characters may not move from here.
cards.gametext: Your Jedi deploy +2 here.   If you occupy, Force generation +1 for you here, and opponent's characters may not move from here.
cards.name: Blockade Flagship: Hallway

cards.gametext: Take top card of Force Pile into hand. OR If opponent just revealed a combat card, it is canceled (place in opponent's Used Pile) and opponent must draw destiny instead (that destiny is reduced by 1). OR Cancel Glancing Blow, Clash Of Sabers, or Obi-Wan's Journal.
cards.lore: Offense may win battles, but defense keeps you alive long enough to mount an offense.
cards.name: Blow Parried

cards.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Adds one battle destiny if with your alien or Imperial (or adds two battle destiny if with your bounty hunter or Vader). Immune to attrition < 5. End of your turn: * Use 2 or (!) Lose 2 or (X).
cards.lore: The most feared \b bounty hunter\b0  in the galaxy. Justifiably, his fee is as large as his reputation.
cards.name: Boba Fett, Bounty Hunter

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Cancels Opee Sea Killer. While no card here, you may place a card from hand face-up here. If you just drew weapon or battle destiny (limit once per destiny draw), you may exchange it for card here, which then counts as that destiny draw. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Elongated fish found in the depths of Naboo oceans. It utilizes its large claw-like appendages to hold onto its prey for long periods of time before finally consuming its meal.
cards.name: Colo Claw Fish

cards.gametext: Plays on table. While you occupy a battleground and opponent occupies less than two battlegrounds, cancel: Asteroid Sanctuary, opponent's Force drains at non-battleground locations, and opponent's Force retrieval.
cards.lore: "Chewie! Come here!"
cards.name: Come Here You Big Coward

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Once during your deploy phase, you may deploy a non-Interrupt card with "door" in title from your Reserve Deck; reshuffle. At Endor sites where you have a scout, Rebel scouts are power -1 and forfeit -3. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: "... and bring his companions to me."
cards.name: Conduct Your Search

cards.gametext: Plays on table. S-foils and Maneuvering Flaps are suspended where you have either a weapon present or a starship (or vehicle) with maneuver > 3 present.
cards.lore: Scout walker pilots are trained to set up a deadly heavy fire zone. This tactic can be disrupted by enemy weapons fire.
cards.name: Crossfire

cards.gametext: If opponent just initiated a duel, use 3 Force to cancel it. OR Take Deep Hatred into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If Maul has no combat cards, target a Jedi to place one of their combat cards (random selection) in opponent's Used Pile. (Immune to Sense.)
cards.lore: While Qui-Gon meditated to regain strength lost during the ferocious duel, Darth Maul paced impatiently outside the energy barrier like a caged krayt dragon.
cards.name: Dark Rage

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. You may not play Sniper or You Are Beaten. During any deploy phase, you may place one card face-down under one of your Dark Jedi. (These are that character's combat cards.) No character may have more than two combat cards at once. Instead of drawing lightsaber combat destiny or duel destiny, your participating character may use one of his combat cards. Place character's combat cards in owner's Used Pile when used (or if that character leaves the table).
cards.name: Deep Hatred

cards.gametext: Plays on table. If opponent just retrieved Force using an Interrupt or Utinni Effect, you may place that card here. Opponent's Force retrieval is reduced by X, where X = number of cards here.
cards.lore: Imperial officers are always on the lookout for Rebel espionage.
cards.name: Do They Have A Code Clearance?

cards.gametext: During your control phase, deploy on Theed Palace Generator Core. No more than one character may deploy to here each turn, and characters may not move to or from here. Immediate Effect lost at end of opponent's turn.
cards.lore: Divide and conquer can be a powerful warfare tactic.
cards.name: Energy Walls

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Cancels Order To Engage and Scramble. Once per game you may take any Immediate Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While opponent occupies no battleground systems, Staging Areas is suspended.
cards.lore: The Boonta Eve crowds are always looking for new and exciting developments at every Podrace.
cards.name: Fanfare

cards.gametext: Before any starting cards are revealed, deploy on table with up to 10 cards from outside your deck face-down under here. Cards under here do not count toward your deck limit. Three times per game, may play a Defensive Shield from here, as if from hand.
cards.lore: Maul's arsenal includes much more than simple combat training.
cards.name: Fear Is My Ally

cards.gametext: Target opponent's Jedi with at least one combat card present with your Dark Jedi. Reveal one of target's combat cards (random selection). If revealed card's destiny > 4, place it on top of opponent's Reserve Deck. Otherwise, lose 1 Force. (Immune to Sense.)
cards.lore: A fully-trained Sith warrior has more weapons at his disposal than just a lightsaber.
cards.name: Force Push

cards.gametext: While at Podrace Arena, once during your control phase may 'wager'. Both players draw destiny and add 2 if they have won a Podrace. Loser (lowest total) loses 1 Force. If you just won the wager and Bib Fortuna is present, you may retrieve 1 Force.
cards.lore: \b Gangster\b0  and \b leader\b0  in control of Tatooine. The amount of credits Jabba earns from Podracing is said to be vast, but only Bib Fortuna knows the exact number.
cards.name: Jabba Desilijic Tiure

cards.gametext: Plays on table. While you occupy a Subjugated planet location, operatives are forfeit = 0, operatives do not add to Force drains, and your Force drains may not be reduced. \ul(Subjugated planet is defined on the Objective card Local Uprising.)\ul0
cards.lore: "I will deal with them myself."
cards.name: Leave Them To Me

cards.gametext: [Front Side]: \ul Deploy Theed Palace Generator Core, Theed Palace Generator, and Deep Hatred.\ul0 \par \b While\b0  this side up, opponent may not Force drain where opponent has a Jedi, and your Force drains at Naboo sites where you have a Dark Jedi may not be canceled. Once during your control phase, may target one opponent's character present with your Dark Jedi at an interior Theed Palace site. Target is lost. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if an opponent's Jedi is present at an interior Naboo battleground site.\\par[Back Side]: \b While\b0  this side up, you may not Force drain or initiate battle at any location where you have a Dark Jedi. Once during your move phase, your Dark Jedi may initiate lightsaber combat against an opponent's Jedi present: Each player draws 2 destiny. Loser (lowest total) loses 2 Force (cannot be reduced). If difference is 5 or greater, lost Force must come from Reserve Deck, and losing character is lost. \par \b Flip\b0  this card and retrieve 1 Force if opponent has no Jedi present at any interior Naboo battleground.
cards.name: Let Them Make The First Move/At Last We Will Have Revenge

cards.gametext: Deploys -2 to Naboo. May not be Disarmed. While with Qui-Gon, your battle destinies here are each +1. When Maul wins a lightsaber combat, adds 2 to opponent's Force loss. Immune to Clash Of Sabers and attrition < 5 (or < 6 if armed with a lightsaber).
cards.lore: Sent by Darth Sidious to Naboo in order to assist the Trade Federation in their blockade there. His confrontation with Obi-Wan and Qui-Gon would impact history forever.
cards.name: Lord Maul

cards.gametext: Deploy on Maul. Adds 1 to Maul's lightsaber combat total. May lose 1 Force to add 2 to Force drain where present. Twice per battle, may target a character. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total > defense value. While on Maul, may not be stolen.
cards.lore: Maul's double-bladed lightsaber is two lightsabers fused into one that requires years of training to wield properly. Like its mysterious owner, this weapon hasn't been seen for a millennia.
cards.name: Maul's Double-Bladed Lightsaber

cards.dark_side_text: Your Dark Jedi are power +2 here.
cards.gametext: Your Jedi are power +1 here. Force drain -1 here.   Your Dark Jedi are power +2 here.
cards.light_side_text: Your Jedi are power +1 here. Force drain -1 here.
cards.name: Naboo: Theed Palace Generator

cards.dark_side_text: Any characters of ability < 5 about to be 'hit' here (and all cards on them) are placed in owner's Used Pile.
cards.gametext: Any characters of ability < 5 about to be 'hit' here (and all cards on them) are placed in owner's Used Pile.   Any characters of ability < 5 about to be 'hit' here (and all cards on them) are placed in owner's Used Pile.
cards.light_side_text: Any characters of ability < 5 about to be 'hit' here (and all cards on them) are placed in owner's Used Pile.
cards.name: Naboo: Theed Palace Generator Core

cards.gametext: Plays on table. At opponent's <> site where opponent's creature present, you may deploy without presence or Force icons, and your Force generation there is +1.
cards.lore: Jabba's influence is not easily ignored. Neither are his voracious and vile appetites. Even Jedi soon learn this lesson.
cards.name: No Escape

cards.gametext: If Maul armed with a lightsaber in battle, use 2 Force to draw two destiny. Opponent draws two destiny. If any of your destinies equal any of opponent's destinies, opponent's Jedi is power = 0 for remainder of battle.
cards.lore: Lightsaber duels are so fast and furious that Jedi don't plan their offensive strategy, but instead rely on instinct and their ability to sense an opponent's next strike.
cards.name: No Match For A Sith

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Cancels Sando Aqua Monster. While no card here, may place an opponent's just drawn battle destiny face-up here. If opponent just drew battle destiny with the same card title as card here, place both cards in opponent's Lost Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: With a vicious array of pointed teeth, the opee sea killer is a fearsome hunter. When outmatched in size, it uses small crevices to avoid bigger predators.
cards.name: Opee Sea Killer

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Your Immediate Effects may play for free. Whenever opponent cancels your card with Sense or Alter, place that canceled card in Used Pile.
cards.lore: The Imperial fleet keeps a tight grip on the systems under its control. Abuses and excesses by local citizens are not tolerated.
cards.name: Oppressive Enforcement

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Your Force drains at Hoth sites may not be canceled. Once per turn, if you just deployed an AT-AT to a Hoth site, you may deploy (at -2) a Star Destroyer to the Hoth system (or vice versa) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Ruthless and well-equipped for both air and ground assault, Vader's feared Death Squadron came to the icy Rebel Base with total domination in mind.
cards.name: Prepare For A Surface Attack

cards.gametext: Deploy on a site where Maul just defeated Qui-Gon in lightsaber combat. Place Qui-Gon out of play. While Obi-Wan at this site, his lightsaber combat total is +2 and opponent loses 1 Force at the end of each of your turns. (Immune to Control.)
cards.lore: While Qui-Gon spent years maintaining peace, Maul was sharpening his combat skills. Those years of training came to fruition in one fateful moment.
cards.name: Qui-Gon's End

cards.gametext: Plays on table. While you occupy at least 3 battlegrounds or opponent occupies no battlegrounds, you lose no more than 2 Force from each Force drain or 'insert' card.
cards.lore: Oola had to choose between giving in to Jabba's constant advances or resisting him and inciting his wrath.
cards.name: Resistance

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Cancels Colo Claw Fish. While no card here, you may draw destiny and place it face-up here. If you are about to draw a card for weapon or battle destiny, you may instead use card here, then place it in Lost Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Huge creature that is feline in nature and moves on its hind legs. Slow movement makes it difficult for the monster to feed, but whenever a confrontation arises it always wins.
cards.name: Sando Aqua Monster

cards.gametext: Plays on table. If opponent is about to retrieve X Force, opponent must first use X Force or that retrieval is canceled. (X is equal to the full amount of Force allowed to be retrieved, regardless of the number of cards in opponent's Lost Pile.)
cards.lore: Imperial computer systems are equipped with complex algorithms designed to prevent access by unauthorized users.
cards.name: Secret Plans

cards.gametext: Imperial leaders present may not be targeted by weapons. While with an Imperial leader, adds one battle destiny. While at an opponent's site, Force drain +1 here (or +2 if also a Rebel Base). End of your turn: * Use 1 or (!) Lose 1 or (X).
cards.lore: The Imperial Navy's ruthless shock troops. The distinctive white armor of the stormtrooper is recognized throughout the galaxy as a feared occupational force.
cards.name: Stormtrooper Garrison

cards.gametext: Activate 1 Force. OR Add 1 to your just-drawn duel destiny. OR If under your Dark Jedi as one of that character's combat cards, reveal to opponent and place in your Lost Pile to cancel an opponent's Force drain. (Immune to Sense.)
cards.lore: Lightsaber confrontations are a complex dance of feints, strikes, parries, and footwork. Mistakes are rarely forgiven.
cards.name: The Ebb Of Battle

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. While Amidala with Jabba, her game text is canceled. While you occupy an [Episode 1] Tatooine site with [Episode 1] Jabba, once per turn you may place a card from hand in your Used Pile to draw a card from Reserve Deck. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: "If they discovered her..."
cards.name: The Hutts Are Gangsters

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Sense and Alter are now Lost Interrupts. When any player makes a destiny draw for Sense or Alter, and that destiny draw is successful, that player loses 2 Force.
cards.lore: "Always with you what cannot be done."
cards.name: There Is No Try

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Opponent's movement from a Bespin location to a non-Bespin location requires +1 Force. Once per game, \ul Executor\ul0  deploys for free to Bespin system. Once per turn, may take into hand a TIE just forfeited from a Bespin location.
cards.lore: Vader's plans were to turn the city in the clouds into a graveyard for the Rebellion.
cards.name: They Must Never Again Leave This City

cards.gametext: Deploys -2 to a Jabba's Palace site. If opponent just initiated battle at same site, may use X Force (limit 2) to add twice X to total power. Your alien leaders present may not be targeted by weapons. End of your turn: * Use 2 or (!) Lose 1 or (X).
cards.lore: Jabba the Hutt knew that having a big, strong, dumb guard was good, but having lots of them is better.
cards.name: Thok & Thug

cards.gametext: If opponent just initiated battle against Maul where opponent has two Jedi, cancel that battle and you may relocate one of those Jedi (your choice) to any adjacent site. That Jedi may not move for remainder of turn. (Immune to Sense.)
cards.lore: Obi-Wan was anxious, Qui-Gon was patient, and Maul was angry.
cards.name: Through The Corridor

cards.gametext: During your turn, target an opponent's unpiloted starship present at a system, or an opponent's unpiloted vehicle. Target is lost (along with any cards aboard it). OR Cancel Hyper Escape, Power Pivot, or Out Of Commission.
cards.lore: With mounting pressure from superior forces, the Rebellion sometimes has to abandon its crippled equipment in order to simply get its personnel out alive.
cards.name: Unsalvageable

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Cancels Frozen Assets and Beggar. Each player may play only one card with 'sabacc' in title each turn. You may cancel an opponent's card with 'sabacc' in title by losing 1 Force from hand.
cards.lore: Qui-Gon was not one to leave the success of an elaborate plan to chance.
cards.name: We'll Let Fate-a Decide, Huh?

cards.gametext: Plays on table. For opponent to steal a weapon from target character using a non-[Episode 1] card, must first draw destiny. If destiny +1 > target's ability, weapon stolen. Otherwise, attempt fails and stealing card is placed out of play.
cards.lore: In order to use his double-bladed weapon Maul trained under Darth Sidious for years.
cards.name: Weapon Of A Sith

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. While no card here, may cancel a Force drain by placing a non-unique destroyer droid here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. During your deploy phase, may use 5 Force to deploy (for free) a destroyer droid from here, as if from hand.
cards.lore: When two Jedi are attempting to breach your bridge, even a destroyer droid's response time seems far too slow.
cards.name: Where Are Those Droidekas?!

cards.gametext: Plays on table. While opponent has a non-unique alien or non-unique starfighter in battle, opponent may not draw more than two battle destiny.
cards.lore: Darth Sidious' command was merciless and direct. He left no room for misinterpretation.
cards.name: Wipe Them Out, All Of Them

cards.gametext: Plays on table. If an 'insert' card was just inserted or revealed, it is canceled.
cards.lore: "Give yourself to the dark side. It is the only way you can save your friends."
cards.name: You Cannot Hide Forever

cards.gametext: Plays on table. Unless opponent occupies three battlegrounds, I Did It! is suspended. If Sebulba's Podracer on table, your Force loss from Boonta Eve Podrace is reduced by X, where X = number of battlegrounds you occupy.
cards.lore: "Not even finished?"
cards.name: You've Never Won A Race?

cards.gametext: Deploys only to a site as an Undercover spy. Reduces Luke's forfeit and immunity to attrition by 2 here. During opponent's control phase, Arica may "break cover" to fire one weapon (for free). Immune to attrition < 4.
cards.lore: Mara Jade posed as a dancer at Jabba's Palace in an attempt to complete her master's task and kill Luke. \b Musician\b0. \b Spy\b0. Unable to convince Jabba to take her on his skiff.
cards.name: Arica

cards.gametext: Permanent weapon is Twin Cannons (may target a character or vehicle using 1 Force; draw destiny; if destiny > defense value, target hit and opponent loses 1 Force). While with another destroyer droid, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
cards.lore: These Trade Federation droids are basically a mobile weapons platform. They were commissioned by the Trade Federation from the Colicoids of Colla IV.
cards.name: Destroyer Droid

cards.gametext: Adds 3 to power of any starship he pilots. When piloting a Star Destroyer in battle, adds one battle destiny. While no other admiral and no Star Cruiser on table, your Admiral's Orders just placed in Used Pile from table may be taken into hand instead.
cards.lore: The last remaining Grand Admiral. Found legendary \ul Katana\ul0  fleet of missing Dreadnaughts. Military genius. Master of unorthodox tactics. Passionate collector of art. \b Leader\b0.
cards.name: Grand Admiral Thrawn

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. When present with Xizor, he may not be targeted by weapons. While Vader not here, opponent may draw no more than one battle destiny here. Immune to purchase, Restraining Bolt, and attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Human-replica droid. Programmed to function as Xizor's personal bodyguard and assassin. Black Sun agent. Cost 9 million credits. Worth every decicred.
cards.name: Guri

cards.gametext: \b Agendas\b0 : ambition, blockade, trade. While in a senate majority, once during your control phase, may search your Force Pile and take any one card there into hand; reshuffle. While at Galactic Senate, your other Neimoidians are forfeit +2.
cards.lore: Primary Neimoidian \b senator\b0  who represents the Trade Federation in the Galactic Senate. Thwarted attempts by Amidala to end the blockade of Naboo.
cards.name: Lott Dod

cards.gametext: Your destroyer droids and battle droids are each forfeit +1 at same and related sites. While aboard Blockade Flagship, opponent's Jedi may not move or deploy to Bridge, and your destroyer droids are destiny +3 if drawn for battle destiny.
cards.lore: Commanding Viceroy of the Trade Federation forces assigned to the blockade of Naboo. Takes responsibility for his own actions. Neimoidian \b leader\b0.
cards.name: Nute Gunray

cards.gametext: Permanent weapon is Twin Cannons (may target a character or vehicle for free; draw destiny; if destiny +2 > defense value, target hit and opponent loses 1 Force). While with a destroyer droid at a site, adds one battle destiny.
cards.lore: Trade Federation droideka led by unit commander P-59. Assisted in the attempt to keep the Jedi ambassadors from breaching the battleship's command center.
cards.name: P-60

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When in battle at a site, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise and total ability of 6 or more required for opponent to draw battle destiny here. Immune to attrition < 5 while Vader not here.
cards.lore: Falleen \b gangster\b0  and \b leader\b0. Black Sun agent. Dark Prince of the Black Sun crime syndicate. Fortifies his personal defenses with information gathered by his agents.
cards.name: Prince Xizor

cards.characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b bounty hunter\b0, \b Wookiee\b0
cards.gametext: Deploys -3 to same site as any smuggler or bounty. During your deploy phase, a Vibro-Ax may deploy for free on Snoova from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. When Snoova excludes a target with a Vibro-Ax, he may capture target instead.
cards.lore: Perhaps the only true Wookiee \b bounty hunter\b0  in the galaxy. Even high ranking members of the Alliance fear him. Favors a vibro-ax for his personal weapon.
cards.name: Snoova

cards.gametext: Opponent's Jedi using landspeed from here require +2 Force. During any control phase may place TC-14 out of play to target one opponent's Jedi present. Target Jedi loses all immunity to attrition and is power = 0 for remainder of turn.
cards.lore: Trade Federation-owned protocol droid used by the Neimoidians to distract the Jedi until a plan could be conceived to deal with them.
cards.name: TC-14

cards.gametext: Deploys for free on Coruscant. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While at a non-Coruscant battleground site and Vengeance Of The Dark Prince is on table, Force drain +1 here. Forfeit +2 when present with Xizor or another Vigo.
cards.lore: One of Xizor's hand-picked lieutenants. Ascended as Black Sun agent from \b gangster\b0  to manager. Earned title of Vigo from old Tionese for 'nephew.'
cards.name: Vigo

cards.gametext: If opponent just Force drained you at a location, deploy on that location. Opponent's Force drains here are +1. Your battle destiny draws here are +1. If you control this location, may place Immediate Effect in Used Pile to retrieve 4 Force. (Immune to Control.)
cards.lore: "This one's a decoy!"
cards.name: After Her!

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. During your draw phase, may use 3 Force: until end of next turn, opponent generates no Force at Naboo sites you control with a battle droid. Place Effect in Lost Pile if you have no battle droids on Naboo. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Battle droid armies require less credits to maintain than the average soldier. Trade Federation tactics are designed to take advantage of these numbers.
cards.name: Naboo Occupation

cards.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on Endor system if opponent controls no Endor sites. Your Force drains are +2 at up to X other battleground systems, where X = number of Endor sites you occupy. Effect canceled if opponent controls three Endor sites. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Rumors of a new 'technological terror' filled the galaxy with dread.
cards.name: Ominous Rumors

cards.gametext: During your control phase, if you have a weapon (except a lightsaber or (permanent weapon)) at a battleground you control, opponent loses 1 Force. OR If you just used a weapon (except a lightsaber or (permanent weapon)) to 'hit' a character or starship, opponent loses 1 Force. (Immune to Sense.)
cards.lore: The Empire always had a large weapons cache held in reserve, in case of an emergency.
cards.name: Imperial Artillery

cards.gametext: If Maul in battle with a Jedi, add one battle destiny (two if Jedi is Qui-Gon). OR Use 1 Force to take any lightsaber into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Target a Jedi present with Maul; they duel: Both players draw 2 destiny. Loser (lowest total) is lost.
cards.lore: A Sith needs no introduction.
cards.name: Maul Strikes

cards.gametext: Deploy on Podrace Arena. Adds 3 to each of your race destinies here. If you and your opponent have the same race total, may use 2 Force. Opponent draws no race destiny for remainder of turn (may only be used once for any race total).
cards.lore: Some hidden modifications mean Sebulba's Podracer doesn't conform to race specifications. The duplicitous Dug has equipped it with a flame emitter that can fry other Podracers.
cards.name: Sebulba's Podracer

cards.gametext: Permanent pilot provides 1 ability. May add Guri as pilot (suspends permanent pilot). Guri deploys aboard for free. When Guri piloting, adds one battle destiny and immune to attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Constructed by a secretive Surronian hive craftguild. Equipped with H2-1 hyperdrive system and emergency braking jets. Guri's personal starship. Gift from Prince Xizor.
cards.name: Stinger

cards.gametext: Permanent pilot provides 1 ability. May add Xizor as pilot (suspends permanent pilot). Xizor deploys -3 aboard. When Xizor piloting, adds one battle destiny and immune to attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Prototype designed by MandalMotors to Prince Xizor's exacting specifications. Contains four separate power generators to power advanced flight controls and engines.
cards.name: Virago

cards.gametext: May pilot only \ul Falcon\ul0. All droids may be battled. Any player that has no ability in a battle takes no battle damage. Once per turn, may take one card with "Bad Feeling" in title into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Bad Feeling Have I is suspended.
cards.lore: Threepio's extensive experience 'talking' to the \ul Falcon\ul0's computer allowed him to pilot the freighter while on Coruscant. Artoo, an R-unit droid, provided moral support.
cards.name: Artoo & Threepio

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power and 2 to manuever of anything he pilots. During your move phase, may use 1 Force to "break cover" of opponent's Undercover spy at same site. Power +3 in battle against opponent's spy or bounty hunter. Immune to attrition < 3.
cards.lore: Corellian. Former counter-intelligence agent and \b spy\b0  for CorSec (Corellian Security). Gifted tactician. One of Wedge Antilles' best pilots. Member of Rogue Squadron.
cards.name: Corran Horn

cards.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting \ul Outrider\ul0, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise and, once per battle, may reduce power of one opponent's starship in same battle by power of \ul Outrider\ul0  for remainder of battle.
cards.lore: Emperor banished Rendar family from Coruscant. Became \b gambler\b0  and \b smuggler\b0. Brought down AT-AT at the Battle of Hoth. Works for Rebel Alliance from time to time.
cards.name: Dash Rendar

cards.gametext: Deploys -2 on Tatooine. When at a Tatooine site, adds one battle destiny. Permanent weapon is vibro-ax (may target character for free; both players draw destiny; target excluded from battle if your destiny +4 > target's power + opponent's destiny).
cards.lore: \b Gambler\b0. \b Spy\b0  in Jabba's Court. Has walked the palace's passageways and overheard many details of Jabba's operations on Tatooine.
cards.name: Lando With Vibro-Ax

cards.gametext: May cancel immunity to attrition of any vehicle here. If escorted by Vader and Take Your Father's Place on table, during your move phase may relocate Vader (with Luke) to Death Star II: Throne Room. Immune to Always Thinking With Your Stomach and attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Resourceful \b scout\b0  and member of the Rebel infiltration team assembled to destroy the shield generator. Surrendered to his father so that he would not endanger the mission.
cards.name: Luke Skywalker, Rebel Scout

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. When piloting \ul Pulsar Skate\ul0, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Once per turn, may use 1 Force to place a card from hand on bottom of Used Pile and draw top card of Reserve Deck.
cards.lore: Called 'Myra' by childhood friend Wedge Antilles. Corellian \b smuggler\b0. Captain of the \ul Pulsar Skate\ul0. Responsible for starship repairs and upgrades. \b Information Broker\b0.
cards.name: Mirax Terrik

cards.gametext: Deploys free to Lars' Moisture Farm. Draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. If opponent has a Stormtrooper at a Tatooine site, you may not play Harvest. If lost during opponent's turn, Luke is power +6 until end of your next turn.
cards.lore: Watchful guardians of Luke Skywalker. When the Lars' moisture farm was attacked by stormtroopers, Luke's life changed forever.
cards.name: Owen Lars & Beru Lars

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once during each of your control phases, may peek at one card from opponent's hand or top card of opponent's Reserve Deck. At same location, your smugglers are each forfeit +2 and defense value +2.
cards.lore: \b Smuggler\b0  and \b information broker\b0. Operates intelligence network. Pragmatic businessman. Strong sense of personal honor. Bounty placed on his head by Grand Admiral Thrawn.
cards.name: Talon Karrde

cards.gametext: Deploy on Luke or Obi-Wan. Your characters present armed with a unique (*) lightsaber weapon card may not be Disarmed, once per battle may cancel a weapon destiny just drawn, and that lightsaber's Force drain modifiers may not be canceled. Lost if about to be stolen.
cards.lore: Written by Obi-Wan Kenobi. Used by Luke to construct his lightsaber. Contained instructions on building required tools as well. Keyed to self-destruct if not opened by Luke.
cards.name: Obi-Wan's Journal

cards.gametext: If opponent just Force drained you at a location, deploy on that location. Opponent's Force drains here are +1. Your battle destiny draws here are +1. If you control this location, may place Immediate Effect in Used Pile to retrieve 4 Force. (Immune to Control.)
cards.lore: The Queen realized that you must give up one battle in order to have an advantage in the next.
cards.name: They Win This Round

cards.gametext: If Luke is in a battle with Owen or Beru, add one battle destiny (two if both). OR If Owen or Beru is on table, retrieve any one card (two if both, four if both present at Lars' Moisture Farm).
cards.lore: "Harvest is when I need you the most. It's only one season more. This year we'll make enough on the harvest that I'll be able to hire some more hands."
cards.name: Harvest

cards.gametext: During your control phase, if you have a weapon (except a lightsaber, or (permanent weapon)) at a battleground you control, opponent loses 1 Force. OR If you just used a weapon (except a lightsaber or (permanent weapon)) to hit a character or starship, opponent loses 1 Force. (Immune to Sense.)
cards.lore: The Rebel Alliance utilizes every piece of equipment, ammunition and personnel it can muster.
cards.name: Rebel Artillery

cards.gametext: Each of your admirals and generals is forfeit +1 for remainder of turn. OR If your admiral is in battle at a system (or your general, except Obi-Wan, is in battle at a site), you may either add one battle destiny or prevent opponent from drawing more than one battle destiny.
cards.lore: In times of greatest need, the Rebellion relies on the brilliant leadership provided by commanders fighting for freedom.
cards.name: Rebel Leadership

cards.gametext: Deploy on Podrace Arena. Draws 2 race destiny instead of 1. During your draw phase, if opponent has a higher race total than Anakin's Podracer, draw 3 race destiny next turn and choose 2. Once per game may take I Did It! into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
cards.lore: Built from Radon-Ulzer racing engines that Watto regarded as too burned-out to be of any use. New fuel injection subsystem created by Anakin radically increases thrust.
cards.name: Anakin's Podracer

cards.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 1 passenger. Utinni Effects which retrieve Force are immune to Alter, but are placed out of play when completed. While Dash or Leebo piloting, immune to attrition < 4.
cards.lore: Highly modified Corellian Engineering Corporation YT-2400. KonGar KGDefender military grade ion engines. Griffyn/Y2TG hyperdrive. Never boarded by Imperial customs.
cards.name: Outrider

cards.gametext: Deploy on Amidala. May target a character or creature for free. Draw destiny. Character is power and forfeit = 0 if destiny > defense value. Creature lost if destiny +2 > defense value.
cards.lore: Amidala's ability as a warrior is underestimated by those who encounter her. With her weapon of choice, she often uses this fact to her advantage.
cards.name: Amidala's Blaster

cards.gametext: While Luke is not on Tatooine your total Force generation is +1. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 5, also adds 2 to maneuver. Immune to attrition < 3.
cards.lore: Son of Anakin Skywalker. Student of Obi-Wan Kenobi. Honed piloting skills while bullseyeing womp rats in Beggar's Canyon aboard T-16 skyhopper.
cards.name: Luke Skywalker

cards.gametext: When a battle was just initiated where present, may use 1 Force to choose one opponent's character of ability = 1 present to move away (for free), or that character is lost. Immune to attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Jedi Knight. Trained by Yoda. Friend of Bail Organa. General Kenobi became a hero of the Old Republic during the Clone Wars. Mentor of Anakin and Luke Skywalker.
cards.name: Obi-Wan Kenobi

cards.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 2, also adds 2 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. May use 1 Force to take one Corellian Slip into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
cards.lore: Highly decorated Corellian. Piloted Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. A wealthy orphan, he bought a freighter with his inheritance. First joined the Alliance as weapons \b smuggler\b0.
cards.name: Wedge Antilles

cards.gametext: Deploy on your Skywalker of ability > 3. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
cards.lore: Constructed by Anakin Skywalker. Kept by Obi-Wan Kenobi until given to Luke.
cards.name: Anakin's Lightsaber

cards.gametext: Deploy on Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
cards.lore: "An elegant weapon for a more civilized time." Miniaturized power cell. Uses rare crystals to focus the lightblade. This lightsaber was personally built by Obi-Wan.
cards.name: Obi-Wan's Lightsaber

cards.characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b bounty hunter\b0, female
cards.gametext: May use any 'stolen' lightsaber. Once per turn, may steal a lightsaber from an opponent's character just lost where present. Immune to attrition < 3 (< 5 while armed with a lightsaber).
cards.lore: \b Bounty hunter\b0. Former student of the Force. After failing her Jedi training, Aurra became known for hunting down and killing Jedi Knights.
cards.name: Aurra Sing

cards.gametext: Deploys for free to Thrawn's location. Each other Imperial aboard same capital starship is forfeit +2. Adds 2 to power of any capital starship he pilots (3 if \ul Chimaera\ul0). While aboard \ul Chimaera\ul0  with Thrawn, also adds 2 to that starship's armor and hyperspeed.
cards.lore: Corellian \b leader\b0. Lied about his age to enter the Academy. Took command of \ul Chimaera\ul0  when its captain was killed at the Battle of Endor. Admires Grand Admiral Thrawn.
cards.name: Captain Gilad Pellaeon

cards.gametext: Deploys -2 to Tatooine. During your control phase may lose 1 Force to duel opponent's Jedi present. Both players draw 2 destiny. Loser is lost. Unless opponent's character of ability > 3 here, opponent's total ability here = 0. Immune to attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Apprentice to Darth Sidious. Sent to capture Queen Amidala on Tatooine. Full of anger and fury as a child. Sidious used Maul's pent-up rage to train him in the ways of the Sith.
cards.name: Darth Maul

cards.gametext: May 'fly' (landspeed = 2). Once during each of your turns, may take Watto's Chance Cube into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
cards.lore: Toydarian junk dealer. Skilled \b gambler\b0. Won Shmi and Anakin in a Podrace bet with Gardulla the Hutt. Jedi mind tricks don't work on him, only money.
cards.name: Watto

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per turn, if Maul on table, may deploy a Neimoidian from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While present with an opponent's Jedi, Maul is defense value +2 and immune to attrition. If Maul just lost, place Effect in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Mysterious \b hologram\b0  that communicates with the Trade Federation, directing their blockade of Naboo. "This is getting out of hand. Now there are two of them!"
cards.name: The Phantom Menace

cards.gametext: Take any non-unique destroyer droid into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR During your deploy phase, relocate your destroyer droid to an adjacent site.
cards.lore: The Colicoids from Colla IV modeled destroyer droids after themselves in that they can roll up into a ball and move swiftly into a conflict.
cards.name: Rolling Rolling Rolling

cards.gametext: May add 2 pilots. Maul deploys -3 aboard. While Maul piloting, immune to attrition and during your move phase, may lose 2 Force to 'cloak' (does not participate in battles) until end of next turn.
cards.lore: One of Sienar Advanced Projects Laboratories' prototype designs. Equipped with advanced weaponry and a full-effect stygium-based cloaking device for invisibility on command.
cards.name: Maul's Sith Infiltrator

cards.gametext: Deploys +3 to any location except Jedi Council Chamber. While at Jedi Council Chamber, immune to attrition and once during your control phase, if Amidala at a battleground site and Maul not on table, opponent loses 2 Force.
cards.lore: Senior \b Jedi Council member\b0  who maintains rigorous adherence to the Code. Sent Qui-Gon to Naboo to accompany the Queen and learn more about the mysterious "dark warrior."
cards.name: Mace Windu

cards.gametext: Deploys -2 on Coruscant. If opponent's Dark Jedi on table, during your move phase may use 4 Force to return Qui-Gon (and all cards on him) to owner's hand. Immune to attrition and You Are Beaten.
cards.lore: Jedi Master currently not on the Council. Although he serves the Council well, there have been times when he has defied their wishes to pursue a path he believes is right.
cards.name: Master Qui-Gon

cards.gametext: Deploys -2 to Tatooine. If opponent just initiated a battle at a related Tatooine site, may use 2 Force to relocate Obi-Wan to that site. Immune to attrition < 4.
cards.lore: Qui-Gon Jinn's Padawan. Stayed behind to protect Queen Amidala when Qui-Gon left to explore Mos Espa, but was in constant communication should he be needed.
cards.name: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner

cards.gametext: Twice per game may deploy Qui-Gon or Obi-Wan here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While present with your Jedi at a site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons.
cards.lore: Queen Amidala posed as one of her own handmaidens for added safety as well as to keep an eye on her Jedi protectors. Was to be protected by the Jedi at all times.
cards.name: Padm Naberrie

cards.gametext: Deploy on Podrace Arena. Once per game, either player may initiate a Podrace: During opponent's control phase, each player may draw one race destiny. Each player may place any drawn race destiny on their Podracer (or on Podrace Arena if they have none) or in their Used Pile. During any move phase, winner is any player with a race total > 24 and greater than opponent's highest race total. Winner retrieves 6 Force and loser loses 6 Force. Place all race destiny cards in owner's Used Piles and all Podracers are lost.
cards.name: Boonta Eve Podrace

cards.gametext: Relocate Jar Jar to a battle just initiated at an adjacent site. OR Increase Jar Jar's landspeed by 1 for remainder of turn. OR If Jar Jar on Brisky Morning Munchen, take him into hand.
cards.lore: Jar Jar Binks's courage on the battlefield put quite a thorn in the Trade Federation's side. Many believed it wasn't actually courage.
cards.name: Gimme A Lift!

cards.gametext: Deploy on Qui-Gon. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
cards.lore: Qui-Gon was forced to defend himself when Darth Maul tracked them down on Tatooine. He was barely able to escape, in order to fight another day.
cards.name: Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber

cards.gametext: At each system where any player does not have both a starfighter and a capital starship present, that player's starships there are power -2. At sites related to systems you occupy, during each battle opponent may draw no more than one battle destiny. Once during each of your deploy phases, you may deploy one combat vehicle from your Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
cards.name: Battle Deployment

cards.gametext: Power +2 at Cantina. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once per turn, may exchange a docking bay from hand with top card of Lost Pile. Your docking bay transit is free when moving to or from same site. Immune to attrition < 3.
cards.lore: Elder of a dextrous race of renowned travelers. \b Gambler\b0. Frequents casinos, bars and spaceports. Originally from distant planet Dor Nameth.
cards.name: Brangus Glee

cards.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything they pilot. Power -3 if opponent has a lightsaber present. Draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. May target any other character present that was just 'hit'. Target character is lost.
cards.lore: \b Smugglers\b0  who met each other in the Corellian system. Gained the rights to Han Solo's old smuggling routes from Jabba the Hutt. They don't like you either...
cards.name: Dr. Evazan & Ponda Baba

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. The not-so-good doctor may 'operate' on any other character present that was just 'hit' or just Disarmed; 'patient' is lost.
cards.lore: Thug. \b Smuggler\b0. Twisted 'doctor.' Disfigured by blaster. Has death sentence in over 12 systems. Notorious partner of Ponda Baba. Aliases: Dr. Cornelius and Roofoo.
cards.name: Dr. Evazan

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots or drives. When driving a transport vehicle, adds one battle destiny. When piloting at a cloud sector, once per turn may add one battle destiny during battle at a related exterior site.
cards.lore: \b Smugglers\b0. Candidates who resent authority often abandon Imperial academies to sell their piloting skills to criminals. Will work for any high paying crime syndicate.
cards.name: Mercenary Pilot

cards.gametext: Deploys -2 to a Jabba's Palace site. When with your alien leader, adds one battle destiny. May escort a captive. To use his landspeed requires +1 Force. May not be targeted by weapons unless your other aliens present are each 'hit'. Immune to attrition < 4.
cards.lore: Hutt \b leader\b0  of notorious criminal organization. \b Gangster\b0  of the vilest ilk. Would rather forfeit a fortune in cash than risk one whisper attesting to his mercy.
cards.name: Mighty Jabba

cards.gametext: When deployed, immediately retrieve 1 Force. Limit 1 Sith Probe Droid per location. If present with Amidala during your control phase may use 3 Force to relocate this Sith Probe Droid to Maul's site, and relocate Maul to same site as Amidala.
cards.lore: Patrol droids utilized by the Sith. Each droid has several multispectral imaging devices and a communications package. Used by Maul to track down Amidala.
cards.name: Sith Probe Droid

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Once during each of your turns, may deploy one Boelo, Bib, Ephant Mon, Jabba's Sail Barge, Jabba's Space Cruiser, or Hutt Influence from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Also, your aliens aboard Jabba's Sail Barge are immune to attrition < 6. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Jabba runs his organization out of a palace built around a B'omarr monastery. His fortress near the border of the western Dune Sea is safe from enemies in Mos Eisley.
cards.name: Power Of The Hutt

cards.gametext: Deploy on table if 5th marker also on table. During your control phase, opponent loses 1 Force for each marker site you occupy with an AT-AT. Once per game, may take both Walker Garrison and 3rd Marker into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Echo Base was no match for the Imperial war machine.
cards.name: You May Start Your Landing

cards.gametext: Use 2 Force to target two opponent's Jedi at same interior battleground. Targets may not participate in battle for remainder of turn. OR Target opponent's Jedi. Draw destiny. If destiny > 2, target's game text is canceled for remainder of turn.
cards.lore: Green gas that is lethal to most carbon-based life forms.
cards.name: Dioxis

cards.gametext: If opponent's starship has just begun to move through hyperspace, draw destiny. If destiny > pilot's ability, starship must return to original location and may not move this turn. If destiny = pilot's ability, starship is lost.
cards.lore: "Traveling through hyperspace ain't like dustin' crops, boy!" Gravititational phenomena cast shadows in hyperspace, posing a serious threat to lightspeed navigation.
cards.name: Gravity Shadow

cards.gametext: If a Dark Jedi and a Rebel with ability > 2 are involved in the same battle, you may add one battle destiny (add two destiny if Rebel is Luke).
cards.lore: "Several fighters have broken off from the main group. Come with me." Darth Vader targets his TIE fighter's fire-linked blaster cannons at the Rebel pilots in the trench.
cards.name: I Have You Now

cards.gametext: Take one admiral or general into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If your admiral is in battle at a system (or your general is in battle at a site), you may either add one battle destiny or prevent opponent from drawing more than one battle destiny.
cards.lore: The Emperor's high command is subjected to close scrutiny by the Imperial bureaucracy. Despite this apparent lack of trust, many turned out to be fine commanders.
cards.name: Imperial Command

cards.dark_side_text: Maul deploys free here. If Maul here and If The Trace Was Correct on table, Force drain +2 here.
cards.gametext: If Amidala at a battleground site (or captive), opponent may not Force drain here.   Maul deploys free here. If Maul here and If The Trace Was Correct on table, Force drain +2 here.
cards.light_side_text: If Amidala at a battleground site (or captive), opponent may not Force drain here.
cards.name: Tatooine: Desert Landing Site

cards.gametext: Deploy on Maul. While on Maul, may not be stolen. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
cards.lore: Trained in the Sith arts, Maul's ferocity in combat is matched by no other. When armed with a lightsaber, his opponent's only option is usually that of escape.
cards.name: Maul's Lightsaber

cards.gametext: Deploys -1 to same site as Amidala. Once per game, may deploy a blaster on Panaka from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, if Panaka just fired a blaster and 'hit' a character, opponent loses 2 Force.
cards.lore: \b Leader\b0  of Amidala's royal guard who personally supervised the Queen's weapon and self-defense training. Served under Captain Magneta before his current assignment.
cards.name: Captain Panaka

cards.gametext: Deploys -3 to same site as Leia. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if \ul Falcon\ul0). Once per turn, may target opponent's character at same site who has power < 4 and cancel target's game text for remainder of turn.
cards.lore: Chewie honored his life debt to Han by protecting Leia. Posed as the mercenary Snoova while on Coruscant. \b Smuggler\b0. Wookiee.
cards.name: Chewbacca, Protector

cards.gametext: May deploy to any site, even without presence or Force icons. During battle may use 1 Force to target one opponent's character present. Both players draw destiny. If your destiny +2 > opponent's destiny + target's ability, Jar Jar and target are lost.
cards.lore: Young Otolla Gungan. Clumsy. Outcast from Otoh Gunga for continually making mistakes that placed other members of Gungan society at risk.
cards.name: Jar Jar Binks

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (or 3 to power of anything he drives). When driving a transport vehicle, it moves for free and he adds one battle destiny.
cards.lore: \b Smugglers\b0  from many worlds are hunted by the Empire for providing arms and supplies to the Alliance. The Outer Rim is their refuge.
cards.name: Palace Raider

cards.gametext: Deploys only if Rescue The Princess on table. May not be transferred while imprisoned. Adds 2 to your Force drains here. For remainder of game, your objective cannot be placed out of play and, if Leia not on table, flip Sometimes I Amaze Even Myself.
cards.lore: Princess Leia Organa. Alderaanian senator. Targeted by Vader for capture and interrogation. The Dark Lord of the Sith wanted her alive.
cards.name: Prisoner 2187

cards.gametext: Deploys for free to Slave Quarters. Once per game may take [Tatooine] Threepio into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While in a battle at a site, subtracts one from each of opponent's battle destiny draws.
cards.lore: Mother of Anakin Skywalker. As Anakin grew, Shmi realized her son was special. Did her best to hide his abilities from Watto.
cards.name: Shmi Skywalker

cards.gametext: Deploy on 1st marker. Yavin 4 locations do not count for Imperial Decree. S-foils and your 'insert' cards are canceled. Once during each of your turns, may take up to two sites (or one site and one Effect) with 'Echo' in title or one planet system with two (Light Side Force icon) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Due to constant Imperial pursuit, Alliance engineers became adept at constructing new facilities quickly.
cards.name: A New Secret Base

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per game, may deploy Jar Jar from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If you just lost Jar Jar from a site, may place him here. At any time, may use 3 Force to take Jar Jar from here into hand.
cards.lore: "Den boom! Getten berry scared, and grabben dat Jedi, and pow! Mesa here. Huh! Mesa getten berry, berry scared. Mm."
cards.name: Brisky Morning Munchen

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Rogue T-47s are immune to attrition < 4 (or < 6 if matching pilot aboard). Once during each of your turns, may take one maintenance droid, Bacta Tank, Lone Rogue, [Hoth] Luke, [Special Edition] Wedge, Zev, or Hobbie into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
cards.lore: "All troop carriers will assemble at the north entrance. The heavy transport ships will leave as soon as they're loaded."
cards.name: Echo Base Garrison

cards.gametext: Deploy on table. Once during each of your turns, may deploy one Underworld Contacts, [Jabba's Palace] Lando, [Jabba's Palace] Leia, R2-D2, or C-3PO from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Also, while Luke is at a Jabba's Palace site, opponent's aliens there must use +1 Force to use their landspeed.
cards.lore: "With your wisdom, I'm sure that we can work out an arrangement which will be mutually beneficial and enable us to avoid any unpleasant confrontation."
cards.name: Seeking An Audience

cards.gametext: Deploy on table if you've won a Podrace. Once per game, may place Boonta Eve Podrace out of play to retrieve 4 Force. If you occupy a battleground site and a battleground system, once during each of your control phases may reveal the bottom card of your Lost Pile and place it on top of your Force Pile. At the end of opponent's turn, opponent must lose 2 Force or place their Force Pile onto their Used Pile.
cards.name: I Did It!

cards.gametext: USED: Cancel Overseeing It Personally. OR Use 4 Force to cancel Vader's game text for remainder of turn. LOST: If Emperor just lost from table, draw destiny. Opponent must lose Force equal to the destiny draw.
cards.lore: The turning of Vader and the loss of Palpatine was the beginning of a new era for the entire galaxy.
cards.name: End Of A Reign

cards.dark_side_text: Non-unique lightsaber Force drain bonuses everywhere are canceled.
cards.gametext: [Episode 1] Yoda may deploy here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to Revolution.   Non-unique lightsaber Force drain bonuses everywhere are canceled.
cards.light_side_text: [Episode 1] Yoda may deploy here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to Revolution.
cards.name: Coruscant: Jedi Council Chamber

cards.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 6 passengers. May add ability of your (*) unique smuggler aboard to X on Kessel Run targeting that smuggler. When Booster, Mirax, or Wedge piloting, immune to attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Owned by legendary Terrik family of smugglers. Used to chase down the pirates who killed Wedge's parents. On Corellian Security's most wanted list. 37.5 meters long.
cards.name: Pulsar Skate

cards.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 5 passengers. Weapons may not deploy on this starship. While Ric piloting, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise, and immune to Lateral Damage and attrition < 4.
cards.lore: Chromium-plated, sleek transport ship used by the royalty of the Naboo. Spaceframe was designed around a J-type configuration.
cards.name: Queen's Royal Starship

cards.gametext: May add 3 pilots and 3 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. While Madakor or Williams piloting, immune to Lateral Damage and attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Optimized for diplomatic missions with sensor-proof pods that have ejection capabilities. Easily identified by its red coloration.
cards.name: Radiant VII

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When with Vader in a battle, once per battle may cancel one opponent's destiny just drawn.
cards.lore: \b Leader\b0. Governor of Outer Rim Territories. Commanded Death Star. Helped disband Imperial Senate. Defined doctrine of rule by fear. Plotted to use Death Star against Emperor.
cards.name: Grand Moff Tarkin

cards.gametext: If both players have a character with a weapon present at same site, deploy on that opponent's character during any control phase. Character loses all weapons, is power -1 and may no longer carry weapons. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: C-3PO's arm was pulled off by attacking Tusken Raiders. "I don't think I can make it. You go on, Master Luke...I'm done for."
cards.name: Disarmed

cards.gametext: Deploy on Podrace Arena. Once per game, either player may initiate a Podrace: During your control phase, each player may draw one race destiny. Each player may place any drawn race destiny on their Podracer (or on Podrace Arena if they have none) or in their Used Pile. During any move phase, winner is any player with a race total > 24 and greater than opponent's highest race total. Winner retrieves 6 Force and loser loses 6 Force. Place all race destiny cards in owner's Used Piles and all Podracers are lost.
cards.name: Boonta Eve Podrace

cards.gametext: If Vader and Obi-Wan are present at same site, use 1 Force to initiate a duel between them. Compare their power, and add 2 if that character is armed with a lightsaber. Loser (lowest total) of duel is placed out of play.
cards.lore: Vader and Obi-Wan Kenobi fought a final lightsaber duel near Hangar Bay 327 on the Death Star. "When I left you I was but the learner; now I am the master."
cards.name: The Circle Is Now Complete

cards.gametext: If you have a piloted AT-AT or AT-ST present at a site, target opponent's character, 'crashed' vehicle or unpiloted vehicle without armor present. Draw destiny. Character lost if destiny > ability. Vehicle lost if destiny < 7.
cards.lore: The enormous feet of a walker are designed for mobility on many types of terrain. They also can be used by merciless pilots to crush the Rebellion.
cards.name: Trample
